update.description:
Normal maps have not been working for some time, and we have also disabled them in the gazebo models that use them, e.g. see [this line in fast_food's model.sdf](#!/osrf/gazebo_models/src/ea482a46e821ac9fe9618e469c5bf65742b42eb1/fast_food/model.sdf?fileviewer=file-view-default#model.sdf-28)

The fix only works for ubuntu with OGRE 1.9. I tried applying the same changes to the shaders in our `media/rtshaderlib` directory used by gazebo on OSX but still didn't have any luck so I disabled normal mapping on OSX for now. 

I also removed unused material scripts in the rtshader directories.

See a screenshot of the fast food model before and after applying its normal map.

Before:

![fastfood_no_normal.jpg](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/225576924-fastfood_no_normal.jpg)

After:

![fastfood_normal.jpg](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/3812733778-fastfood_normal.jpg)
update.title: Fix normal maps on ubuntu with OGRE 1.9 and disable on OSX

pullrequest.title: Fix normal maps on ubuntu with OGRE 1.9 and disable on OSX

content.raw: the `enableNormalMap` variable is actually in `RTShaderSystem.cc`. The check here is for individual visual so if this fails for one visual we still want to keep normal map enabled in RTShaderSystem for other visuals. From what I observed, If tangent vectors fail to build, the mesh is still rendered but just appears as if no normal map is applied.
content.html: the enableNormalMap variable is actually in RTShaderSystem.cc. The check here is for individual visual so if this fails for one visual we still want to keep normal map enabled in RTShaderSystem for other visuals. From what I observed, If tangent vectors fail to build, the mesh is still rendered but just appears as if no normal map is applied.

content.raw: Do you want to set `enableNormalMap` to false in the `catch`?
content.html: Do you want to set enableNormalMap to false in the catch?
